intro: Soleirolia corsica, commonly known as Corsican carpet grass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It forms dense, mat-like growths with small, bright green leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in Corsica and other Mediterranean islands.
